sentences: käin erariides - keegi ei paku, ja mina muidugi ei küsi kroonurõivastust
context: The word 'käin' is the first-person singular present tense form of the Estonian verb käima, which means 'to go', 'to walk', or 'to visit'. In this context from O. Luts's writing, it shows the speaker stating that they still wear civilian clothes (rather than official/crown clothing) - indicating they go about in their regular attire.
